'This coloring book exceeded my expectations. The pages can be easily removed so my daughter can play with one page at a time so the book will last us for a very long time. I totally recommend it.'

'Easily our favourite make of colouring books for our toddler. The photos are big and simple enough for the youngest of ‘artists,’ and will keep them busy for a really long time as there’s tons of pages. Highly recommend! We’re working our way through the collection.'

title: Mindfulness for Teens in 10 Minutes a Day
author: Jennie Marie Battistin
description:
Calm your mind and find your best self with 10-minute mindfulness exercises for teens

Learn how to use mindfulness, or the ability to be fully aware in the present moment, to reduce everyday stress. Mindfulness for Teens in 10 Minutes a Day shows you how to take control of your feelings and focus your attention with short, simple mindfulness activities.

Discover a wide variety of mindfulness techniques that will fit easily into your routine and help you thrive in every area of life. These engaging exercises show you how to find peace in the face of stress, improve relationships with friends and family, boost your self-esteem, and increase your focus to help you succeed at school and work.

This book about mindfulness for teens includes:

  • Short practice, big benefits--Take just a few minutes each day to find calm, focus, reconnect with your emotions, and respond to challenging situations.

  • Exercises for going deeper--Find suggestions for connecting more deeply with each activity, including journal prompts and meditations for further reflection.

  • Breathing techniques--Learn three key breathwork techniques to help you relax, reduce anxiety, and energize your body.

Improve focus, reduce stress, and be fully present with help from Mindfulness for Teens in 10 Minutes a Day.
about_author: Jennie Marie Battistin MA, LMFT, is a licensed marriage family therapist in the State of California. She graduated Cum Laude with a Masters in Clinical Psychology from Pepperdine University in Malibu, CA. Jennie Marie began her career working with teens on Burbank High School campus. She is a frequent guest speaker at high schools in Southern California. She has been a facilitator for Angst: A Documentary on Anxiety, which helped create a dialogue of support between students, teachers, and parents on the challenges of coping with anxiety. As a mother of grown children, she has a strong passion for helping teens and parents develop tools and resources to help navigate challenges and mental health concerns facing today's teens. Jennie Marie is the founding director of Hope Therapy Center Inc. Marriage and Family Counseling of Burbank, CA and Santa Clarita, CA, with plans to expand offices to Orange County California and Washington State.
review:
"I enthusiastically recommend this book. I think that using these exercises in the classroom would aid in creating a more enriching teaching environment. A mindful student becomes a successful student."--Mary Jane Heater, M.Ed, Co-author of Team Teaching Science: Success for All Learners

"Navigating the day-to-day stress and anxiety of teens can be a challenge! As a junior high school teacher and mom of two, I found Jennie Marie's practical daily mindfulness exercises to be the perfect complement to my work both at home and school. 'Procrastination Pit' and 'Show Me the Love' are just two examples of relatable exercises that have proven to reduce stress and help my students and me become more productive. This is a must-read for all parents, teachers, and teens!"--Aimee Bastin, Department of Exceptional Learners Chairperson and Resource Teacher in Fishers, Indiana

"Teens live at the heart of the digital age, bombarded with images that only compound the natural developmental stressors and pressure that come with adolescence. In this straightforward guide to mindful ways of being, Jennie Marie Battistin has taken the mystery out of mindfulness and compiled an easy-to-read and utilize guide to informing everyday activities with awareness, self-regulation, and increased calm--the counterbalance to stress. This is a 'must-read' for teens and parents alike!"--Rhea Harris-Junge, MFT, Certified EMDR Therapist, Certified Havening Practitioner, Eating Disorder Specialist

"This book is a great tool for teens and adults alike--whether they're in therapy or not. The exercises are simple, quick, and well-organized into easily-digestible sections. With world stress levels at an all-time high and attention-spans at an all-time low, mindfulness has never been more important to have. Especially useful for our teens and young adults who are under increasing pressure to achieve at all costs and navigate an ever-changing social and technological landscape, this book serves up bite-sized morsels to help sooth stress, forge focus, and prevail in the present."--Julia Young, MA, LMFT, LPCC, Founder & CEO of Caring Connected

title: The 101 Coolest Simple Science Experiments
author: Holly Homer & Rachel Miller
description: These fun, accessible activities will get your kids learning about the world around them, the human body and laws of force, attraction and energy. Holly Homer and Rachel Miller are the women behind the bestselling book 101 Kids Activities That Are The Bestest, Funnest Ever! And the wildly popular site KidsActivitiesBlog.com, which has over 10,000 subscribers, 614,000 Facebook likes and 13,000 Twitter followers. Make pickles glow, mix magnetic mud, build terrariums or explore centrifugal force. With these indoor and outdoor activities, everyday ingredients and tips for adjusting according to your child's age, you'll have hours and hours of fun, learning and discovery with your family. These engaging activities are a perfect way to spend enjoyable quality- time with your kids and to introduce them to the fun of science and discovery.
about_author:
Holly Homer and Rachel Miller are the dynamic duo behind the popular website Kids Activities Blog and the co-authors of several engaging activity books for children and teens. Both authors are passionate about creating fun, educational, and simple activities that encourage learning and creativity.

Holly Homer is a blogger, author, and mother of three boys. She co-founded the Kids Activities Blog to share her love of creative and practical activities that parents can do with their children. Her work focuses on making learning fun and accessible for families, and she has a knack for turning everyday items into exciting projects.

Rachel Miller is also a blogger, author, and mother. She brings her experience and creativity to the table, crafting activities that inspire curiosity and hands-on learning. Rachel's innovative ideas and approachable style have made her a beloved figure among parents and educators looking for new ways to engage their kids.

Together, Holly and Rachel have co-authored several books, including "101 Kids Activities That Are the Bestest, Funnest Ever!" and "101 Coolest Simple Science Experiments: Awesome Things To Do With Your Parents, Babysitters and Other Adults." Their books are filled with easy-to-follow instructions and use readily available materials, making them perfect for busy parents and curious kids alike.

Holly and Rachel's collaborative efforts have earned them a loyal following, and their books continue to be a valuable resource for families seeking to enrich their children's playtime with meaningful and enjoyable activities.
review:
"The team at Kids Activities Blog are the best at coming up with super fun ways for parents and kids to connect through hands-on play, and this new book is no exception. It has such great ideas to get your kids hypothesizing, concocting and experimenting in their very own kitchen-turned-science-lab."
--Stephanie Morgan, founder of Modern Parents Messy Kids

"What's the formula for hands-on fun This book. The 101 Coolest Simple Science Experiments will have your kids begging to learn more."
--Stephanie Keeping, founder of Spaceships and Laser Beams

 

'Great book the children loved doing the experiments and learning through play.'

'Great started science book. I like how it shows the science question, method, results and alternative things to do.'

'I am a homeschooling mom to 3 young children who still need a majority of their math & language arts lesson taught to them individually. This book has easily helped me to introduce a love and facination with science to my children without being overly complicated or too difficult to carry out (a huge plus when working with younger children). Each experiment lists simple to follow intructions, ingredience, tips, estimated time frames, the level of ease and even how messy it is! Plus, the scientific concepts are explained in a very kid honoring way! My children get it! Many items used in the experiments can already be found around the house or picked up from a local dollar store. I would recommend reading through the experiments to familiarize yourself with common ingredients so that you can make sure that you have the staple ingredience and/or household items on hand and then prepare to pick up others as you go, noting which items could be saved and used again for future experiments.

My children LOVE doing these experiments and are so excited to tell their friends about them! They want to do them over and over again. Their ages 6, 4 and a 4 month old baby. :-)'

title: Escape Room Puzzles: Solve the puzzles to break out from ten fiendish rooms
author: James Hamer-Morton
description:
This is the perfect book for fans of Journal 29, and those who want to re-create an exciting escape-room experience in their own home!

Escape Room Puzzles is perfect for reading with your family and friends, and it contains ten intricate escape rooms to solve in your living room.

Become Adam Parkinson, a young investigative journalist, and join his conspiracy-theorist friend Henry Fielding as they take on the diabolical Wexell Corporation. You must guide Adam through ten precarious rooms, solving the puzzles he finds in each one, discovering what Wexell are up to, and then escaping to the next location.

Written by an expert escape room creator, Escape Room Puzzles can be enjoyed either on your own or played as a group. The story takes you from Adam's apartment in London to an ancient ruin buried under a Spanish city... and beyond. There are a wide variety of puzzle types, including traditional puzzles on the page and more interactive puzzles that involve paper-crafting.

Ten rooms are presented from which the reader should attempt to escape. Each contains a number of puzzles that all need to be solved, as well as interactive elements and artworks to provide an engaging experience for the escapee to puzzle their way out of. Hints in three different difficulty levels and solutions are included.

Enter the world of Escape Room Puzzles, but beware ... once you enter, you only have a limited time to solve the puzzles before time runs out and you are locked in forever! The book presents 10 rooms in which the reader needs to pit their wits against the diabolical Wexell Corporation. Each room contains new challenging puzzles, requiring the utmost concentration and skill to solve.

Written by an experienced escape room creator, Escape Room Puzzles can be enjoyed either on your own or played as a group.
about_author:
James Hamer-Morton is a talented creator and author, best known for his innovative contributions to the world of escape room puzzles. As the co-founder of Deadlocked Rooms, he has played a pivotal role in designing and developing a number of highly acclaimed physical escape rooms across the United Kingdom. His escape rooms are celebrated for their intricate design, challenging puzzles, and immersive experiences, attracting enthusiasts from all over.

In addition to his hands-on work in creating escape rooms, James has successfully transitioned his expertise into the literary world. He is the author of "Escape Room Puzzles", a book that brings the excitement and challenge of escape rooms into readers' homes. The book features a variety of puzzles and riddles that test problem-solving skills and creativity, offering an engaging experience for puzzle lovers.

James also authored the "Sherlock Holmes Escape Room Puzzle Book", which combines the classic intrigue of Sherlock Holmes with the interactive challenge of escape rooms. This book allows readers to step into the shoes of the famous detective, solving puzzles and unraveling mysteries in a format that blends narrative and interactive elements seamlessly.

James Hamer-Morton’s work stands out for its ability to captivate and challenge both escape room enthusiasts and puzzle book readers. His innovative approach to puzzle design and storytelling continues to inspire and entertain, making him a prominent figure in the escape room and puzzle book communities.
review:
'The most successful attempt I've seen yet at translating the escape room concept into book form. The creativity of the puzzles is superb' --Escape the Review

'I love a good puzzle, and this is many many good puzzles wrapped up in a series of challenging escape rooms. Lots of visual puzzles, codes to work out, pieces to put together - with hints and solutions at the back if you get stuck. I'm about half way through it at the moment and the going is getting trickier - but there's such a sense of satisfaction when you work out individual elements and then see how they go together. The overall story that links all the rooms isn't too intrusive into the main point of discovering and solving clues, and ties it all together well. I would fully recommend this to any escape room afficionados and people who don't give up too easily.'

'I really wanted to love this book as I am a big fan of the physical and board game escape rooms. Each of the 10 chapters is full of clues and puzzles to solve in order to progress the story and move onto the next chapter. However, despite some good elements in the book, there are various issues such as typos and errors that can leave you unable to solve the puzzles without resorting to the solutions page.

Pros: The book looks nice, with good quality paper and illustrations. The coherent storyline made me want to progress so I could find out what happens next and I found that some puzzles or whole chapters worked really well together and were a lot of fun to solve. It’s also a really good price, given the amount of puzzles it contains.

Cons: As mentioned above, there are some misprints and errors. For example, in chapter 1 the character supposedly finds a 5x5 grid but the page actually shows a 5x6 grid. This created some confusion about whether or not this was a deliberate clue that we were supposed to notice. However, it was just a mistake. Another misprint guides you to the wrong answer for part of a puzzle. These small errors early in the book impacted the overall enjoyment as you can never quite be sure whether you have accurate information or not.

The book does promise a challenge although sometimes this amounts to you having to commit to a lot of time-consuming work in order to solve a puzzle. Each section contains a lot of text with different clues and puzzle pieces. The result is that more time is spent working out which clues go together than actually solving the puzzles. There are hints available, but I mostly found that either I already knew the information or that the hints were too obscure to be helpful.

I was also confused by the fact that after completing a section, the book will sometimes reveal the code/ answer you have been working on and sometimes it won’t. This leaves you having to check the solutions page just to work out whether you reached the correct answer not.

Overall, it’s an interesting attempt although the errors and inconsistencies can be particularly frustrating, especially when they stop you being able to solve the puzzles. I think it would have been improved by paying more attention to the details of the puzzles and sometimes by giving more obvious connections between clues. However, I’ve enjoyed it enough to persevere, hence the rating of 3 stars.'

title: Complete Flags of the World
author: DK
description:
From Antigua to New Zealand discover the flags of the world with this complete guide published in association with the Flag Institute

Travel to each country of the world using the small-scale map and find out about over 300 national, international, official and provincial flags from across the globe.

Each national flag is covered: detailed notes and annotations will tell you all about its history, design development, the significance of colours, symbols, crests and coats of arms and any recent changes. Updates include new flags for Montenegro, Kosovo and Lesotho.

Also features flags of major international organizations plus key flags in world history.
about_author:
DK (Dorling Kindersley) is a world-renowned publisher of highly visual, engaging, and informative books for readers of all ages. Established in 1974, DK has built a reputation for creating meticulously researched and beautifully illustrated books that cover a wide range of subjects, from travel and history to science and children's literature.

"Complete Flags of the World" is one of DK's popular titles, offering readers a comprehensive guide to the flags of nations around the globe. The book features detailed illustrations and fascinating facts about the history, symbolism, and design of each flag, making it an invaluable resource for students, educators, and anyone interested in vexillology (the study of flags).

DK's publications are known for their clear and accessible content, combining stunning visuals with authoritative information. This approach ensures that readers not only learn but also enjoy the process of discovery. Whether it's through encyclopedias, reference books, or activity guides, DK continues to inspire curiosity and a love of learning in readers of all ages.

With a commitment to quality and a passion for knowledge, DK remains a trusted and beloved name in publishing, offering books that educate, entertain, and enlighten.
review:
'This is my new favourite book and it is used by all the family too. It shows how little I knew about world flags.'

'It's a great book with concise explanations, and lovely glossy pages. The font size is perfect for easy reading, and the flags are bright and clear. Would recommend this book to kids and adults.'

'It is an excellent book that every child should have. It explains what each symbol in the flag signifies and is good source of knowledge.'

'This book is a good reference book. It has most (but not all) current flags shown in very clear colour.
It shows the flags by Continent and then by Country.
Once found, easy to use and read. However Countries are not in Alphabetical order. I can not determine the reason of order in the book. Hence, the search is best done slowly using the Index for the Country in Question. The search in the reverse order - Flag and what country is it? relies entirely on working through the book page by page (all 240 pages) until a match is found. Not impossible but not easy either.
UK shows The Union Jack, as well as flags for England, Scotland, Wales, Isle of Man, Jersey and Guernsey. It also shows the Royal Standard. It does not show The Red Ensign, Blue Ensign White Ensign or the RAF Ensign or the special ensign used by the Royal Yacht Squadron.'

title: River Cottage Everyday
author: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall
description: Putting food on the table for the family quickly and economically doesn't mean you have to compromise on quality. This book shows how Hugh's approach to food can be adapted to suit any growing, working family, or busy young singles and couples for that matter. Breakfast, baking, lunchboxes, quick suppers, healthy snacks, eating on the move and weekend cooking for the week ahead - all these, and more, are covered in River Cottage Every Day. As Hugh says: 'I make no prior assumptions about where you shop, what you may or may not know about growing vegetables or keeping livestock, whether you can tell the difference between a swede and turnip, or know what to do with a belly of pork and a breast of lamb. Instead, I'll show you easy and confidence-inspiring ways with cuts of meat, types of fish and other ingredients you may not have tried before. And I'll offer you new approaches that I hope will breath new life to familiar staples, like rice, spuds, beans, and your daily bread. Above all, I intend to tempt you irresistibly towards a better life with food, with a whole raft of recipes that I think you will love. I hope some of them will become your absolute favourites, and the favourites of your dear friends and beloved family. I hope that the dishes you like best will infiltrate and influence your cooking, giving you increased confidence and fresh ideas. In short, I hope that before long, cooking simple and delicious food from the best seasonal ingredients becomes second nature and first priority for you, not just once in a while, but every day.'
about_author:
Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall is a multi-award-winning writer and broadcaster known for his uncompromising commitment to seasonal, ethically produced food and his concern for the environment. He has earned a huge following through his River Cottage TV series and books, as well as campaigning documentary series such as Hugh’s Fish Fight, Hugh’s War on Waste, Britain’s Fat Fight and War on Plastic with Hugh and Anita. A new River Cottage series, River Cottage Reunited aired in June 2022.

Hugh established River Cottage HQ in Dorset in 2004, and the operation is now based at Park Farm near Axminster in Devon. An organic smallholding, HQ is also the hub for a broad range of courses and events, and home to the River Cottage Cookery School. Hugh continues to teach and host events there on a regular basis. He also oversees the menu and sourcing in the River Cottage Kitchen, the restaurant on site at HQ.

Hugh’s broadcasting has earned him a BAFTA as well as awards from Radio 4, The Observer and the Guild of Food Writers. His award-winning books include The River Cottage Cookbook (2001), which won the Glenfiddich Trophy, the River Cottage Meat Book, which won the Andre Simon Award in the UK as well as the James Beard Award in the US. Hugh’s latest book How to Eat 30 Plants a Week, a Sunday Times bestseller, was published in May 2024.

Hugh continues to work as a journalist, writing occasionally for the Guardian, Times and other national newspapers. He is a vice president of Fauna & Flora International and a patron of Switchback, a charity that helps young offenders find opportunities in the catering industry.
review:
`Full of down-to-earth recipes that you long to try out' --Vanessa Berridge, Daily Express
`The recipes are refreshing and achievable, as Hugh goes back to basics to prove that everyday food can be wholesome, full of flavour and fun' --Cavan Scott, Countryfile
`This book shows you how to incorporate his philosophy into your own meals, through a great selection of delicious recipes.' --Daily Mail

'I often find that when following recipes it never quite meets expectation, always blaming it on the fact I cooked it and food always tasts better when someone else prepares it. Hugh's book has been the most used cook book on my shelf, I had to pack a charity bag for the other less/never used books. I am the only vegetarian in my household and as the main cook I always want to ensure that veggie meals are tasty for us all.
Hughs soup's have been a comfort throughout the winter, homemade pot noodles are still my favourite for quick work recipes, his bread dough recipes works a treat every time and we always make our own pizza bases without fail. The dough goes a long way. The caponata recipes is lovely. These are the recipes off the top of my head but I love this book as it is wholesome, hearty, rustic cooking, right up my street and most likely to have the ingredients in my cupboard which make it so much easier when looking for spontaneous inspiration for a dinner idea.
I used to be the veggie that would hate being near meat or anyone eating meat so Hugh took a while to grow on me as his meat prepatations appeared quite brutal at face value however over time I have grown to love what he stands for so when he decided to do the everyday veg series I knew I would love it.
I have a family I want them to make their own decision in the future about whether or not they want to eat meat. So I do prepare meat for them a few times a week, what a turn around, and thanks to inspiration from Hugh's programmes I know the best meats to source and the importance of the ethics surrounding the life and death of the animal providing the meat...But I am still veggie so this book is for me and I love it, I am so pleased he wrote this book.'

'One of the few cook books (and I have many ...) that I refer to on a weekly basis.
Excellent recipes, generally simple to make with easy-to-find ingredients. Something for every meal at any time of year. The fried halloumi salad has become a real favourite and we use the dressing with all sorts of other meals. The turkish-style flat breads are absolutely brilliant too.
Would be great for students as well as older people looking to try a few new things.
If you buy one cookbook this year, make it this one!'

title: Cook on a Shoestring
author: Sophie Wright
description:
• Book Overview: "Cook on a Shoestring" is a testament to Sophie Wright's commitment to making great food accessible, regardless of budget constraints. The book offers a collection of inventive and tasty recipes designed to be both affordable and easy to prepare.
  • Themes and Approach: The recipes in "Cook on a Shoestring" focus on maximizing flavor while minimizing cost, making it an ideal resource for students, young professionals, families, or anyone looking to eat well without breaking the bank. Sophie emphasizes the importance of smart shopping, meal planning, and making the most of seasonal produce.
  • Reception: The book has been praised for its practicality and creativity, helping many home cooks enjoy a variety of delicious meals without spending a fortune.

Sophie Wright shows that making meals on a budget doesn't have to mean settling for the same boring, tasteless dinners. Her inventive and inspiring ideas make the most of meals such as roasting a chicken and using the leftovers to make a variety of dishes - from Chicken and Sweetcorn Chowder using stock from the carcass to Shredded Chicken with Pomegranate and Cardamom Scented Wild Rice. She illustrates how to get the best from storecupboard staples such as pasta and tinned beans and pulses, plus how sensible shopping can make the most of a few simple ingredients and avoid 'buy one get one free' offers going bad in the bottom of the fridge. Sophie's expert tips and delicious recipes will ensure you get value and quality for your money, without breaking the bank.
about_author:
Sophie Wright is a renowned British chef and author, celebrated for her innovative and accessible approach to cooking. Born and raised in the UK, Sophie developed a passion for cooking at a young age and honed her skills at the prestigious Westminster Kingsway College, where she trained as a professional chef.

Career Highlights:

  • Early Success: Sophie quickly made a name for herself in the culinary world, becoming one of the youngest head chefs in London by the age of 20. Her talent and dedication have earned her numerous accolades and opportunities to work in top kitchens.
  • Television and Media: Beyond her work in restaurants, Sophie has also become a familiar face on television. She has appeared on various cooking shows and food-related programs, sharing her expertise and passion with a broader audience.
  • Culinary Writing: Sophie Wright is the author of several cookbooks, each reflecting her philosophy of making delicious, wholesome food accessible to everyone. Her books are known for their practical advice, creative recipes, and focus on using fresh, affordable ingredients.

"Cook on a Shoestring":

  • Book Overview: "Cook on a Shoestring" is a testament to Sophie Wright's commitment to making great food accessible, regardless of budget constraints. The book offers a collection of inventive and tasty recipes designed to be both affordable and easy to prepare.
  • Themes and Approach: The recipes in "Cook on a Shoestring" focus on maximizing flavor while minimizing cost, making it an ideal resource for students, young professionals, families, or anyone looking to eat well without breaking the bank. Sophie emphasizes the importance of smart shopping, meal planning, and making the most of seasonal produce.
  • Reception: The book has been praised for its practicality and creativity, helping many home cooks enjoy a variety of delicious meals without spending a fortune.

Personal Philosophy:

Sophie Wright's approach to cooking is rooted in her belief that good food should be accessible to all. She advocates for sustainable practices, reducing food waste, and making the most of simple, high-quality ingredients. Her recipes often highlight her ability to transform humble ingredients into extraordinary dishes.

Community Engagement:

In addition to her professional work, Sophie is involved in various community and charitable initiatives. She frequently participates in cooking demonstrations, workshops, and events aimed at promoting healthy eating and cooking skills, particularly among young people and underserved communities.
review:
'Sophie's easy-to-follow recipes make whisking up a feast effortlessly simple.'  Food and Travel
'From slow-roasted lamb to elderflower jelly granita, chef Sophie Wright reveals how to host a dinner party for six under £5 per head.' The Times
'Eat well, spend less: Give your wallet a well-earned break with these thrifty and wholesome home dinners.' --Women's Fitness

'Our youngest has just left home and I am back to cooking for two. I borrowed some cook books from the library for a bit of inspiration, but most had weird ingredients that I can't buy locally or were just too much trouble. This one I had to buy and keep. It uses normal store cupboard ingredients, easy to buy and inexpensive, but the ideas are fresh and interesting. Most are easy to put together, ideal for a week night after work when you want something different but don't have the energy to spend hours slaving over, but there are also some special recipes and even some that have interesting ideas for the leftovers. Highly recommended.'

'How refreshing to find a cookery book that uses everyday and store cupboard ingredients with such flair. Sophie has a very clever way of marrying flavours to make the staple ingredients we use everyday taste special. Her enthusiasm for cooking is catching. Try the paprika and orange mackerel, easy, cheap and really tasty.'

'If i could i would give this cookbook more than 5 stars!!! I want to make every recipe in the book they all look and sound fabulous. I have over 400 cookbooks but this is my current favourite by far. I can't recommend this book highly enough and suggest you order your copy now!!!'

'Dont use recipe books as a rule. But I heard this lady being interviewed on BBC Radio about this book. very useful to use up left overs. Only two of us to cook for and often have left overs. So found this ideal saves waste.'

title: Murderous Maths Box Set
author: Poskitt Kjartan
description:
Overview: The "Murderous Maths Box Set" by Kjartan Poskitt is a collection of entertaining and educational books that make learning mathematics fun and accessible for children and young readers. This series is renowned for its humorous approach to explaining complex mathematical concepts, making it a favorite among students, parents, and educators.

Contents: The box set typically includes multiple books from the "Murderous Maths" series, each focusing on different areas of mathematics. Some of the popular titles that may be included are:

  • "The Essential Arithmetricks"
  • "The Brain-Bending Basics"
  • "Guaranteed to Bend Your Brain"
  • "Do You Feel Lucky?"
  • "Desperate Measures"
  • "Savage Shapes"
  • "The Perfect Sausage"

Each book is filled with engaging stories, puzzles, tricks, and challenges that illustrate mathematical principles in an enjoyable and memorable way.

Themes and Approach:

  • Humor and Fun: The series uses humor and fun scenarios to explain mathematical concepts, making them more relatable and less intimidating for young readers.
  • Practical Applications: Each book demonstrates how mathematics is used in real life, from everyday activities to extraordinary feats, helping students understand the relevance and importance of the subject.
  • Interactive Content: The books are filled with interactive content such as puzzles, quizzes, and games that encourage active participation and critical thinking.

Reception: The "Murderous Maths" series has been widely praised for its innovative approach to teaching mathematics. It has received positive reviews from educators, parents, and students for its ability to make learning math enjoyable and effective.

Educational Impact: The series is designed to complement traditional math education by providing a different perspective on the subject. It is suitable for children who might struggle with conventional methods or who simply want to explore mathematics in a more engaging way.
about_author:
Kjartan Poskitt is a British author and presenter, best known for his work in making mathematics entertaining and accessible. Born on May 15, 1956, Poskitt has a background in engineering and a passion for education. He has written numerous books and presented television programs aimed at demystifying mathematics and encouraging a love for learning among children.

Illustrations: The "Murderous Maths" series is also well-known for its lively and humorous illustrations by Philip Reeve and other artists, which add an extra layer of engagement and fun to the mathematical content. The illustrations help to break down complex ideas and keep readers entertained throughout.
review:
'Best books to teach math and set the foundations. I even like to read these out instead of the usual bed time stories!! The author made math that interesting! Brilliant find and one of my best buys, I plan to treasure this collection forever! Wish I grew up reading these!'

'The books are well-written and easy to understand, with a great mix of humour and educational content. The illustrations and graphics are eye-catching and help bring the concepts to life in a way that is both entertaining and informative.
Some of the books are challenging for my son.'

'If your kids are into maths this is a winner - even if they are not it's a good way of getting them interested in a fun and non-stuffy way.'

'I began to read these with my 9 year old and very bright 5 year old. The language is fun and accessible to us all and they both asked good questions and I was able to identify where they needed help with their maths easily.'

'At first I thought it would be too advanced for my 1st grader, but she was mesmerized by the stories in the books so much so that I sought out for the rest of the 3 Murderous Maths books. I contacted the author but he said they are not planning to publish the rest again, so I had to buy them used on Amazon and Ebay. They are such wonderful books that it was worth it!! The author is also extremely friendly in writing the emails!
This is the way to get kids interested in math and love it!!! I hope every child can be inspired by math with these books! Yes some topics are advanced for my daughter, but there was so much fun in it that it didn't matter to her. She would get so absorbed in the reading and rereading. She doesn't go in order, she just grabs one and starts randomly. I think in a few years when she is learning the more advanced math, she will have some foundation from these books and in turn, enjoy these books even more!'

title: Bulging Box of Books (Horrible Science)
author: Nick Arnold (Author), Scholastic (Contributor)
description:
Twenty titles from the best-selling series, presented in a bulging boxed set. Features all the best-selling Horrible Science titles from A-Z - well from Blood, Bones and Body Bits to Vicious Veg! 

Titles: 

  1. Angry Animals 
  2. Blood, Bones and Body 
  3. Bits Bulging Brains

  5. Deadly Diseases

  7. Evolve or Die 
  8. Fatal Forces 
  9. Frightening Light 
  10. Killer Energy 
  11. Microscopic Monsters
  12. Nasty Nature 
  13. Painful Poison 
  14. Shocking Electricity

  16. Dreadful Space, Stars and Slimy Aliens 
  17. The Fight for Flight

  19. Ugly Bugs

Content and Themes:

  • Humorous Approach: The series uses humor and cartoons to explain scientific concepts, making them more relatable and less intimidating for children.
  • Educational Value: Despite its playful presentation, the "Horrible Science" series is well-researched and provides accurate scientific information.
  • Interactive and Engaging: The books are filled with fun facts, quizzes, experiments, and illustrations that encourage active learning and curiosity about science.

Reception: The "Horrible Science" series has been widely praised for its ability to engage young readers and spark an interest in science. It is a favorite among children, parents, and educators for its entertaining yet informative approach.
about_author:
Nick Arnold is a prolific British author, best known for his "Horrible Science" series, which has become a staple in children's educational literature. Born on August 4, 1961, in Cambridge, England, Arnold has dedicated his career to making science accessible, engaging, and fun for young readers.

Nick Arnold’s dedication to making science entertaining and understandable has had a significant impact on children's literature and science education. His "Horrible Science" series continues to be a beloved resource for young learners around the world, combining education with fun in a way that truly resonates with his audience.

Career Highlights:

  • Horrible Science Series: Launched in 1996, the "Horrible Science" series quickly became popular for its humorous and irreverent take on scientific topics. The series covers a wide range of subjects, including biology, chemistry, physics, and earth sciences, all presented with a mix of facts, jokes, and cartoons.
  • Educational Impact: Arnold's work is praised for its ability to demystify complex scientific concepts and present them in a way that is both entertaining and educational. His books are often used in schools and libraries to supplement science curricula and inspire a love of learning in students.
  • Awards and Recognition: The "Horrible Science" series has won several awards, including the Rhône-Poulenc Junior Science Book Prize. Arnold's ability to engage young readers and make science fun has earned him a dedicated following and critical acclaim.

Writing Style and Approach:

  • Humor and Accessibility: Arnold's writing is characterized by its use of humor and accessible language, making science approachable for children. He often uses funny anecdotes, playful language, and vivid illustrations to explain scientific principles.
  • Interactive Elements: His books are filled with interactive elements such as experiments, quizzes, and activities that encourage hands-on learning and active participation.
  • Collaborations: Nick Arnold frequently collaborates with talented illustrators like Tony De Saulles, whose cartoons add a visual element that enhances the humor and educational value of the books.

Personal Philosophy:

Nick Arnold is passionate about making learning fun and believes that curiosity is the key to education. His books aim to spark curiosity and encourage children to ask questions and explore the world of science beyond the classroom.

Beyond Writing:

In addition to his writing, Arnold is an active promoter of science education. He regularly visits schools, libraries, and literary festivals, where he conducts workshops and presentations to engage with young readers and educators directly.
review:
'These are definitely brilliant. First of all non fiction is a great way to get reluctant readers into books and the grosser it is the better for that. I have found that using these or excerpts from these is a good way to get some of the pupils at older ages groups but who are below average readers interested. They are not an easy read for younger and struggling children but interest is what we are after here. These are very like the horrible history series except without the option of watching the TV instead.
Personally I bought a set for my son (6 years old) because of his ongoing fascination with science. Reading them is a little beyond him but only because the nature of the subject means the occasional convoluted latin or medical phrase has to get used so he was quite happy reading about different sorts of plants and animals but gets thrown by dropping in terms like "eukaryote". So it's probably aimed at the 8 year and upward age groups and now I use it by reading and editing on the fly and picking the right book to go with whatever we've been doing recently. So if he's shoved a splinter into his finger we'll have blood, bones and body bits, if we've been staring a bits of plant then tonight's bedtime reading is vicious veg.
In short this wins on all fronts. You can tie them in with other activities, older or better readers can read them independently and reluctant readers can be interested.'

'My two boys absolutely love this set. My 6 year old has been a reluctant reader - but now he comes home from school, grabs a Horrible Science book and happily reads for an hour or two. My almost 8 year old also loves them. The only trouble is when they read out some facts from the book about how people tried to cure/avoid the black death for example. Now I have reached 40, these gruesome facts make me shudder, but I know for sure that I would have loved them when I was young. There is a slightly smaller box of Horrible Geography books which are also great - and I've just bought the Horrible History box of books. Great value, great content.
The only minor gripe I might make is that the books are packed quite tight in the box (could have done with being 0.5cm wider) and you have to lift the books up to see what each one is which a shorter base and bigger lid would have solved.'

'A very good stand-alone purchase but complements the other 'Horrible' series of books very well (Horrible Histories, Horrible Geography, Murderous Maths, et al.). Plenty of carefully chosen stories and collection of facts all presented in the classic 'Horrible' genre. The books are obviously well written and have a positive impact on learning. For example, my 8 yo daughter was able to explain to me how an electric guitar works with respect to the amplification of electric signals generated by the disturbance of the magnetic fields around the pickups - this was in response to her pointing at the pickups and asking what they were, I simply said they were magnets, she then worked out for herself how the generation of sound could be achieved. I asked how she knew this and she said the principles were described in the 'Shocking Electricity' book.'

title: The Hairy Bikers' Great Curries
author: Hairy Bikers
description:
The Hairy Bikers celebrate the nation's favorite dish - the curry.

Who doesn't love a curry? Whether it's a take-away korma at your kitchen table or a lamb biryani at your local Indian restaurant, a curry is everyone's favorite Friday night supper. But curry is so much more. A proper curry can be an exquisitely fragrant dish, with delicate flavors that surprise and titillate your taste buds, and the Hairy Bikers, bestselling authors and BBC presenters, are here to show you how to make the most delicious, authentic curries you've ever tasted in your own kitchen.

In this book, Si and Dave have put together loads of brand-new recipes from around the world - from simple dishes for a quick midweek taste treat to fantastic feasts for a weekend celebration. Their recipes are the real deal, using great techniques and secrets they've discovered on their travels in Asia as well as years of cooking curries themselves. You'll find all the recipes and tips you need to make some mouth-watering meals, with everything from starters to pickles and chutneys. This is the one-stop shop for the curries you've ever tasted - fresh and full of flavor. These are curries for the 21st century.
about_author:
The nation's favourite cooking duo, and beloved food enthusiasts, the Hairy Bikers.

With their unique blend of tasty recipes, cheeky humour and irresistible enthusiasm, the Hairy Bikers have become Britain's favourite food heroes.

Born and bred in Barrow-in-Furness, Dave Myers' versatile skills have taken him to some unusual places. He worked in a steelworks as a student, to finance his studies in Fine Arts, and later joined the BBC as a make-up artist, specialising in prosthetics.

Si King hails from North East England and is a big, blond bearded biker with an infectious laugh. He worked for many years as an Assistant Director and Locations Manager for film and television, including the Harry Potter films.

Si and Dave met on the set of a TV drama in 1995 and have been cooking and riding together ever since. They have now written 19 cookbooks, including The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure, Chicken & Egg, Mums Know Best, Bakeation, Meat Feasts and 12 Days of Christmas. In 2012, the boys shed more than six stone between them on the TV show The Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight and launched a publishing phenomenon. They have also published an acclaimed autobiography, Blood, Sweat & Tyres.

 

Selling in excess of 5.7 million copies of their books, Si and Dave continue to entertain and inspire with their innovative publishing and heartwarming TV shows.

 

www.hairybikers.com
https://www.facebook.com/HairyBikers

https://twitter.com/HairyBikers

Si and Dave have thought of everything, with recipes for obscure Afghan aubergines alongside crowd-pleasers like lamb pasanda and Thai green curry, as well as simple side dishes and accompaniments, such as mango chutney, lime pickle and chapatis ― GREAT BRITISH FOOD MAGAZINE
If you love tucking into a good curry this book is for you. The Hairy Bikers show us that a curry should be an exquisitely fragrant dish, with delicate flavours that surprise and titillate your taste buds ― FOOD & WINE MAGAZINE
The Hairy Bikers have added their magic to curries in their latest book, The Hairy Bikers' Great Curries. The book is overflowing with enticing recipes for all sorts of curries - some familiar, some not. There are recipes for a vast array of accompaniments as well in this really enjoyable book ― CHOICE
Ranging from simple midweek meals to fantastic weekend treats, all of these curries are fragrant, delicious and made from easy-to-find ingredients ― EASY FOOD
a selection of mouthwatering curries - from India, Thailand and Vietnam to Jamaica and Japan - cover everything from simple midweek family meals to fantastic weekend celebrations. This one-stop cookbook demystifies curry for the home cook ― WOMAN & HOME FEEL GOOD FOOD

title: The Tea Book: Experience the World s Finest Teas, Qualities, Infusions, Rituals, Recipes
author: Linda Gaylard
description:
The Tea Book helps you explore the blends, tastings, and ceremonies from around the world and create your own delicious tea traditions.

Where does tea come from? In The Tea Book learn where in the world tea is cultivated and how to drink each variety at its best, with steeping notes and step-by-step recipes.

The Tea Book is your world tour of the art of tea. Visit tea plantations from India to Kenya and explore maps of the world's most important growing regions. Learn to recognize tea-leaf varietals and spot the best types from each region. Recreate a Japanese tea ceremony with a guide to storied traditions and practical implements. Discover the health benefits of green tea. Craft the perfect Chai tea. Try a tasting course to cultivate your sense of tea color, aroma, and taste. Explore the spectrum of herbal, plant, and fruit infusions. The Tea Book covers it all, including history, tradition, and 75 classic and contemporary recipes to steep and share.
about_author:
Overview: "The Tea Book" by Linda Gaylard is a comprehensive and beautifully illustrated guide to the fascinating world of tea. It covers a wide range of topics, including the different types of tea, their qualities, brewing techniques, cultural rituals, and delicious recipes. This book is perfect for both novice tea drinkers and seasoned enthusiasts looking to deepen their understanding of this beloved beverage.

About the Author: Linda Gaylard is a certified tea sommelier, having received her certification from the Tea Association of Canada. With a passion for tea and extensive knowledge of its history, preparation, and cultural significance, Gaylard brings a wealth of expertise to her writing. She is dedicated to educating others about tea and sharing her love for this ancient beverage through her work. In addition to "The Tea Book," Linda Gaylard is known for her engaging presentations and workshops on tea, making her a respected figure in the tea community.

About the Publisher: DK (Dorling Kindersley) is a world-renowned publisher known for creating visually appealing, highly informative books on a wide range of subjects. Established in 1974, DK has built a reputation for producing meticulously researched and beautifully illustrated publications that cater to readers of all ages. DK's commitment to quality and their distinctive visual style make their books a delight to read and explore. "The Tea Book" exemplifies DK's dedication to delivering comprehensive and accessible information, making it a valuable addition to any tea lover's collection.
review:
'One of DK's finest books, so informative and the illustrations are brilliant. Really glad I purchased it.'

'I’m about halfway through reading this book and it’s been great. It explains the different types of plants used, the different processes used to make the different tea types, and the popular tea blends, before looking at the growing regions around the world and tea culture and traditions in those places.
Some parts are a little breath maybe, but it is a very good introduction to the wider variety available and has made me curious far beyond the black tea blends I was curious about originally. Who knows, I might even end up trying some of the recipes at the back of the book.'

'Book time! I have been voraciously reading, it is the time of year where I go deep into the books and tend not to come out again until spring. Today's book is The Tea Book by Linda Gaylard and by one of my favorite publishers, DK. See, DK has a tendency to publish really pretty books, their book on Gemstones is still a classic favorite, but this is about tea and not rocks. From the moment I cracked open the book I was impressed with the visuals, it is beautiful!
But looks alone do not make a book (unless it was a photo book, of course) so how is the substance? First off I will say, I think I found THE perfect book for people new to tea and with a voracious appetite for knowledge. This covers so many of the basics, but instead of stopping there it delves deep into various cultures, history, and regions. I was pleased to see coverage on Korean tea and their tea culture, along with Vietnam and Kenya, and not just the typical China, Japan, India, and Sri Lanka.
There is a large section on recipes, but it is not the more trendy cooking with teas but different drinks using tea. Frankly most of them look so delicious, I plan on breaking a few of them out for events when I have to serve tea to a bunch of people. So many delicious looking recipes, plus a method for making popping spheres meaning an upgrade to bubble teas.
Along with lots of juicy information about tea and recipes, there is a section on herbal teas/tisanes. I had mixed feelings on this, on the one hand it was very valuable information (the wheel of healing was my favorite) and herbal teas are definitely a big part of the tea world, but on the other hand this is space that could have been filled with more info about tea!
At times I wish this book would have delved deeper into various topics, mostly because I really enjoy Linda's writing style (I have been following her blog for a while, good reading there!) and would have loved to have seen more of it combined with DK's signature bombastic visuals. I find myself daydreaming about a book of this style devoted entirely to Yunnan's tea culture or Vietnamese tea. Again, I really cannot stress how I think everyone interested in tea should buy this book, even though a lot of the information presented was a refresher for me, I loved reading it because it is so well written and enjoyable.'

title: Tea: History, Terroirs, Varieties
author: Kevin Gascoyne, Francois Marchand & Jasmin Desharnais (Authors), Jonathan Racine & Hugo Americi (Editors)
description: An updated edition of the "World's Best Tea Book" acclaimed by the 2014 World Tea Awards. This widely praised bestseller has been updated to incorporate the changing tastes of tea drinkers, developments in production, the impact of climate change and an expanded and more highly developed tea market. This third edition improves Tea with this revised and extended content plus new photographs. TeaTime Magazine called Tea "the reference work we've been waiting for", noting its value to students. Library Journal praised it as a "definitive guide to tea (that) will appeal to die-hard tea enthusiasts." Tea House Times found it "quite impressive, well researched, and complete with numerous photographs illustrating the beauty and wonder of tea and tea processing around the world." Tea takes readers on an escorted tour of the world's tea-growing countries-China, Japan, Taiwan, India, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Vietnam and East Africa-where they will discover how, like a fine wine, it is "terroir" (soil and climate) that gives a tea its unique characteristics. The authors own the popular Camellia Sinensis Tea House in Montreal which imports teas directly from producers in these countries. Each author focuses on specific tea regions where they travel every year to work with growers and producers, discover new teas and keep abreast of developments that might, for example, remove a tea from the tea house's menu. The book covers black, green, white, yellow, oolong, pu'er, perfumed, aromatic and smoked teas and includes: An overview of the history of tea; Tea families, varieties, cultivars and grades; How tea is grown, harvested and processed; The tea trade worldwide; Profile interviews with tea industry personalities. Special features that loyal tea drinkers will especially enjoy are: Local tastes and methods of preparing tea (e.g. macha); Tasting notes and infusion accessories; Teapot recommendations; Caffeine, antioxidant and biochemical properties of 35 teas; 15 gourmet recipes using tea; A directory of 42 select teas.
about_author:
Kevin Gascoyne is a renowned tea expert, author, and one of the leading figures in the world of tea. With decades of experience in the tea industry, Gascoyne has traveled extensively through tea-growing regions, sourcing and tasting thousands of teas to bring the best selections to consumers.

Career Highlights:

  • Tea Expertise: Kevin Gascoyne's deep knowledge of tea is built on years of hands-on experience in tea plantations and auctions around the world, particularly in India, China, Japan, and Taiwan. His expertise spans all aspects of tea, from cultivation and production to tasting and blending.
  • Camellia Sinensis Tea House: Gascoyne is one of the co-owners of the Camellia Sinensis Tea House, a renowned tea shop and salon based in Montreal, Canada. The tea house is famous for its high-quality teas and for promoting tea culture through education and tastings.
  • Author: As an author, Kevin Gascoyne has co-written several books on tea, providing valuable insights into the history, culture, and complexities of tea. His writing is appreciated for its depth of knowledge and accessible style.

Notable Works:

  • "Tea: History, Terroirs, Varieties": Co-authored by Kevin Gascoyne, this book is a comprehensive guide to the world of tea. It covers the history, cultivation, and tasting notes of various teas from around the world. The book is celebrated for its detailed information, stunning photography, and its role as an educational resource for both novice and experienced tea drinkers.

Personal Philosophy:

Kevin Gascoyne is dedicated to sharing his passion for tea with others. He believes in the importance of understanding the origins and craftsmanship behind each tea and aims to foster an appreciation for the nuances and complexities that different teas offer. His work as an author and tea expert reflects his commitment to education and the promotion of tea culture globally.

Impact:

Through his books, tea house, and numerous workshops and presentations, Kevin Gascoyne has made a significant impact on the tea community. He is respected not only for his expertise but also for his ability to communicate his passion and knowledge to a wide audience, making the world of tea accessible and enjoyable for all.
review:
A heavily illustrated compendium on non-herbal tea, rich in anti-oxidants and with proven medical benefits... The four writers of this book own The Camellia Sinensis Tea House in Montreal and work as tasters, traveling the world looking for teas... Topics include a primer on tea, varieties, processing, cultivars, making-serving-tasting tea, tea ceremonies, and tea in cooking (with 15 recipes by Quebecois chefs)... The downside to this book: nothing, really -- it is a very comprehensive book.The upside to this book: great pictures and layout.--Dean Tudor"Gothic Epicures" 
Beautifully illustrated... While there is no shortage of tea-related tomes, this definitive guide will appeal to die-hard tea enthusiasts interested in learning about the modern, global industry as well as the history and enjoyment of this ubiquitous beverage.--Rosemarie Lewis, Georgetown County Library"Library Journal" 
(An) in-depth look at various aspects of this widely consumed beverage.... Photographs appear on almost every page. --Terry Peters"North Shore News" 
The reference work we've been waiting for has arrived: a comprehensive, but not-too-weighty, one-volume coverage of the world's teas, abundantly and beautifully illustrated with photos of exceptional quality, fascinating graphs, and fairly good maps. The organization of this huge body of factual material will make students most grateful. --James Norwood Pratt"TeaTime" 
'This book covers lots of interesting information in terms of key producing countries, history, cultivation, how to taste tea, virtues of tea and more. It has the right level of content and visuals for people interested in knowing more about tea. Great overall introduction to the wonderful world of tea!'

'I absolutely recommend this book to everybody who appreciate the world of tea. It is a masterpiece containing detailed information about the history, producing countries, types, cultivation, processing and brewing techniques. I loved it!'

title: The Tea Enthusiast's Handbook: A Guide to the World's Best Teas
author: Mary Lou Heiss & Robert J. Heiss
description:
AROUND THE WORLD IN A TEACUP
Did you know that tea is the most widely consumed beverage on the planet after water? Or that all of the world's tea originates from only three varieties of a single plant? While a cup of tea may be a simple pleasure for most of us, there are a dizzying number of tastes from which to choose. And every tea, whether a delicately sweet green tea from Japan or a bracing, brisk Darjeeling black, tells a story in the cup about the land that nurtured it and the tea-making skills that transformed it.

In this authoritative guide, veteran tea professionals Mary Lou and Robert J. Heiss provide decades of expertise on understanding tea and its origins, the many ways to buy tea, and how to explore and enjoy the six classes of tea (green, yellow, white, oolong, black, and Pu-erh). Additional advice on steeping the perfect cup and storing tea at home, alongside a gallery of more than thirty-fi ve individual teas with tasting notes and descriptions make The Tea Enthusiast's Handbook a singular source of both practical information and rich detail about this fascinating beverage.
about_author:
Mary Lou Heiss and Robert J. Heiss are esteemed tea experts, authors, and entrepreneurs with a deep passion for tea. They have dedicated their careers to exploring, sourcing, and sharing the finest teas from around the world. Their extensive knowledge and experience in the tea industry have made them respected figures in the tea community.

Career Highlights:

  • Tea Trekker: Mary Lou and Robert Heiss are the co-owners of Tea Trekker, a renowned tea business that specializes in sourcing high-quality, traditional teas from esteemed tea-producing regions. Through Tea Trekker, they have introduced countless tea enthusiasts to exceptional teas and provided educational resources about tea culture and practices.
  • Authors: Together, Mary Lou and Robert Heiss have co-authored several acclaimed books on tea, offering insights into the history, cultivation, and tasting of tea. Their collaborative writing is known for its thorough research, engaging narrative, and practical advice for tea lovers.

Notable Works:

  • "The Tea Enthusiast's Handbook: A Guide to the World's Best Teas" (2010): This book serves as an essential guide for both novice and experienced tea drinkers. It provides detailed information on selecting, brewing, and enjoying some of the world's finest teas. Illustrated with beautiful photographs, the book covers various tea types, their unique characteristics, and the best practices for preparation and enjoyment.
  • "The Story of Tea: A Cultural History and Drinking Guide" (2007): Another significant work by the Heisses, this book delves into the rich cultural history of tea and offers an in-depth guide to understanding and appreciating tea.

Personal Philosophy:

Mary Lou and Robert Heiss are committed to promoting a deeper appreciation for tea. They believe that understanding the origins, production methods, and cultural significance of tea enhances the drinking experience. Their work emphasizes the importance of quality and tradition in tea, encouraging readers to explore and enjoy tea with a mindful and informed approach.

Impact:

Through their books, business, and educational efforts, Mary Lou and Robert Heiss have made substantial contributions to the tea community. They have inspired many to develop a passion for tea and to appreciate the complexities and beauty of this ancient beverage. Their expertise and dedication have earned them a loyal following among tea enthusiasts and professionals alike.
review:
'A very in-depth guide to the main types of tea, and also giving a considered opinion on the best of the world's teas, it is fascinating reading, and enables the reader to start to explore the options, where tea is not just something which comes in teabags. It also covers methods of steeping different teas, and how to get the best of the tea you invest in. For the price, this is a great book of knowledge too.'

'This little book has been an education for me and enabled me to enjoy tea in a much more profound way. For example I didn't realise water temperature and steeping time had such an effect on tea - I'd wondered why the green tea I brewed was so bitter - now I know how to brew it it tastes fragrant and sweet! I've also experimented with different types of tea which has enriched my taste experience!'

'This is an excellent book for anyone wanting more in depth knowledge of teas. It breaks it down by country and tea type. It covers a full breadth of teas providing hints and tips on taste and what to look for. An essential guide to better tea knowledge.'

title: The World Atlas of Coffee: From beans to brewing - coffees explored, explained and enjoyed
author: James Hoffmann
description:
1/3 MILLION COPIES SOLD

For everyone who wants to understand more about coffee and its wonderful nuances and possibilities, this is the book to have.
Coffee has never been better, or more interesting, than it is today. Coffee producers have access to more varieties and techniques than ever before and we, as consumers, can share in that expertise to make sure the coffee we drink is the best we can find. Where coffee comes from, how it was harvested, the roasting process and the water used to make the brew are just a few of the factors that influence the taste of what we drink. Champion barista and coffee expert James Hoffmann examines these key factors, looking at varieties of coffee, the influence of terroir, how it is harvested and processed, the roasting methods used, through to the way in which the beans are brewed.
Country by country - from Bolivia to Zambia - he then identifies key characteristics and the methods that determine the quality of that country's output. Along the way we learn about everything from the development of the espresso machine, to why strength guides on supermarket coffee are really not good news. This is the first book to chart the coffee production of over 35 countries, encompassing knowledge never previously published outside the coffee industry.
about_author:
James Hoffmann is a renowned coffee expert, author, and entrepreneur, widely recognized for his extensive knowledge and contributions to the coffee industry. Born in the UK, Hoffmann has dedicated his career to understanding and promoting the complexities and delights of coffee.

Career Highlights:

  • World Barista Champion: In 2007, James Hoffmann won the prestigious World Barista Championship, a testament to his skill and expertise in coffee preparation and presentation.
  • Square Mile Coffee Roasters: Hoffmann co-founded Square Mile Coffee Roasters in 2008, a leading specialty coffee roastery based in London. Square Mile Coffee Roasters is celebrated for its high-quality coffee and commitment to sustainability and ethical sourcing.
  • Author: Hoffmann has authored several influential books on coffee, with "The World Atlas of Coffee" being his most notable work. His writing is highly regarded for its thorough research, clear explanations, and ability to make complex information accessible to a broad audience.

Notable Works:

  • "The World Atlas of Coffee: From Beans to Brewing – Coffees Explored, Explained and Enjoyed" (2014): This book is a comprehensive guide to coffee, covering everything from the origins and cultivation of coffee beans to brewing techniques and flavor profiles. It is widely used by coffee enthusiasts and professionals alike as a definitive resource on coffee.
  • "How to Make the Best Coffee at Home" (2020): Another popular book by Hoffmann, providing practical advice and detailed instructions for brewing excellent coffee at home.

Personal Philosophy:

James Hoffmann is passionate about educating others on the intricacies of coffee. He believes in the importance of understanding the entire coffee supply chain, from farming and processing to roasting and brewing. His work emphasizes quality, sustainability, and the enjoyment of coffee as a craft and an art form.

Educational Outreach:

In addition to his books, Hoffmann is known for his educational efforts through various platforms:

  • YouTube Channel: Hoffmann runs a popular YouTube channel where he shares insights, tutorials, and reviews related to coffee. His engaging and informative videos have garnered a large following among coffee lovers.
  • Speaking Engagements: He frequently speaks at industry conferences, coffee events, and workshops, contributing to the global conversation on coffee standards, innovation, and best practices.

Impact:

James Hoffmann's influence in the coffee world is profound. His dedication to quality, education, and sustainability has helped shape modern coffee culture. He has inspired countless individuals to deepen their appreciation for coffee and to approach it with a greater understanding of its complexities and nuances.

title: Kombucha, Kefir, and Beyond: A Fun and Flavorful Guide to Fermenting Your Own Probiotic Beverages at Home
author: Alex Lewin & Raquel Guajardo
description:
Kombucha, Kefir, and Beyond contains healthy, innovative recipes and instructions to show you how to brew your own delicious, probiotic beverages in your own kitchen.

Fermented foods have taken the world by storm due to their health and real food benefits. They help improve digestion, enable us to better assimilate vitamins and minerals, and strengthen the immune system. And of all fermented foods, drinks are some of the most versatile—and tasty!

You may be able to buy many fermented trips in stores, but making them at home is simple, economical, and makes them even better for you. With just a few ingredients and materials, you can start brewing your own delicious beverages for your family. Kombucha, Kefir, and Beyond is packed with innovative drink recipes, from healthy homemade sodas to traditional kvass and cider, that you can make in your home kitchen and enjoy all year long!

Inside, you’ll learn:

  • Why to ferment your drinks

"Food for Free" is a seminal guide to foraging in the UK, written by the esteemed British author and naturalist Richard Mabey. 'Super little book, filled with useful information. Brought back memories of foraging with my grandfather. I have forgotten much of what I learned as a child, simply because I stopped doing it. This book reminded me. I can now enjoy foraging again with my own grand child. It's small, yes, but no less useful.
Fits nicely into a pocket to take out on walks. I've just purchases another copy as a gift.'

'I recently borrowed an earlier version of this book (Harper Collins Natural History 1989) from a friend and was so impressed I wanted one of my own (and in fact one for a friend too, who was also impressed by the book). The newer version is more compact.
Compared to the earlier version, there is now an index for the recipes, and new recipes have been added. This is quite useful. Unfortunately a few plants have been all but left out, I'm not sure if this is because some of these plants are now endangered or have disappeared altogether. E.g. there was no reference to the marsh mallow - I plant I find particularly intriguing! A more serious omission in my view is the poisonous plants: there is a whole group of plants (e.g. cow parsley, wild parsnip) which to me look almost identical, in the field, to the dropworts and hemlock - very poisonous; the new version does mention some of these in passing (but not in the index) and suggests using a well illustrated field guide in combination with this Gem. I think I found it more practical to have clear descriptions, with clear warnings, in the one book, as in the earlier version.
However, the layout of the new guide, in spite of its tiny size, is beautifully clear and it contains photographs, which is a big improvement. Its size (approx. 12*8*1 cm) means it fits easily in any of my pockets. I can hardly wait for next spring to gather beech leaves and try the beech leaf noyau, a `thickish, sweet spirit ...devastating in its effects' ... !'

The plants in the book have illustrations and photos so it’s pretty easy to recognise what you’re looking at, even for a novice like me. It goes in to a bit of detail on how you would prep and use the plants you’re able to forage, which is really useful too. There’s so many uses for this book - parents out with their kids teaching them a little about nature - all kids love this sort of thing they really do, keep it with you when camping to see what you can add to the campfire, keep it handy when on a hike so you can pick up some snacks along the way, it’s even a great addition for survivalists to learn how to live off the land. Thayer’s extensive knowledge and passion for foraging shine through, making the book an indispensable guide for anyone looking to explore the world of edible wild plants.

Sam Thayer was born in Wausau, Wisconsin, where he first learned to gather wild food in vacant lots, backyards, city parks, and at the edge of town. Later, his family moved to rural southern Wisconsin, and then to Madison. Sam's first presentation on edible wild plants was to his seventh grade science class, demonstrating the foods that he collected regularly on his three-mile walk to school. He began "survival camping" at fourteen and led his first wild food walks when he was 19. After graduating from high school, he moved near the south shore of Lake Superior and built a rustic log cabin on an abandoned farmstead, chasing his childhood dream of "living off the land" while working part-time at a variety of jobs.

Since 2000, when he won the Hazel Wood National Wild Foods Cooking Contest, Sam has been teaching regularly on edible wild plants, giving workshops across the United States. In 2002 he was inducted into the National Wild Foods Hall of Fame at North Bend State Park in West Virginia. His first book, The Forager's Harvest, has won a Midwest Book Award, IPPY Book Award, and was a finalist for the USA Book News Best Books 2007 award. It has been a steady Amazon category best-seller and has sold more than 250,000 copies. His second book, Nature's Garden, has received similar acclaim and sold over 100,000 copies. Incredible Wild Edibles was released November 1, 2017. His newest book: "Sam Thayer's Field Guide to Edible Wild Plants of Eastern and Central North America," was published in 2023 and is a winner of the National Outdoor Book Award in the nature category.

He currently lives in the woods of northwestern Wisconsin with his wife, Melissa, their daughters, Myrica and Rebekah and son, Joshua. Along with speaking and writing, he is also a maple syrup producer, wild rice harvester, owns a small organic orchard, and has been revitalizing a lost tradition of making hickory nut oil.

Besides wild food foraging, Sam is an all-around naturalist with particular interest in reptiles, amphibians, bird watching, botany, and mammals. His passion for wild food extends to studying the origin of cultivated plants and the socio-economic history of the human diet.

For more information, visit his website: Forager's Harvest

'I have been foraging for a couple of years now and after having made good use of the book 'Food for Free' I really wanted to find a detailed and extensive guide to ALL of Britain's wild edibles, to get a solid understanding of the hundreds of different plants that grow freely just waiting to be eaten. In my eyes, The Forager Handbook is that guide.
I should state that this is no field guide, nor do I think it should be considered a novices book. This is for those who really wish to become knowledgeable about the subject. When I first got the book and started flicking through it, it was obvious that a lot of effort and research had gone into it. Page after page of information on all the different plants, good descriptions, any potential hazards, similar species and ways to use them, it's all there. I saw some people saying they weren't too impressed by the black and white images but to be honest the photos are of such good quality (the vast majority of them anyway) that if you were to bring a bit of the plant in question indoors and hold it in front of the page, I have no doubt you would be able to make a positive identification, especially with the descriptions to help. All it takes is a bit of attention to detail, which let's be honest if you are foraging, you are meant to have anyway ;)
The book is divided up in to all the families of plants making it easy to navigate, here and there the author has included a few poisonous plants as learning about these is half the battle when it comes to not poisoning yourself and the way it is written feels like how somebody would talk, as though you have someone there mentoring you which I thought was nice.
In summary, a dozen or fewer average quality photos (take into account there must be a few hundred in the book) is all I can really pick out to fault. The whole book is really quality and I think if you are planning on foraging seriously, you won't be disappointed with it. £20 well spent! :)'

title: The Forager's Calendar: A Seasonal Guide to Nature’s Wild Harvests
author: John Wright
description:
'He writes so engagingly that it's hard to imagine that actual foraging can be more attractive than reading his accounts of it. ...[This book] is a treasure. It is beautifully produced, designed and illustrated.' - John Carey, The Sunday Times
WINNER OF THE GUILD OF FOOD WRITERS AWARD FOR FOOD BOOK OF THE YEAR 2020
WINNER OF WOODLANDS AWARDS BEST WOODLAND BOOK OF THE YEAR 2020
Look out of your window, walk down a country path or go to the beach in Great Britain, and you are sure to see many wild species that you can take home and eat. From dandelions in spring to sloe berries in autumn, via wild garlic, samphire, chanterelles and even grasshoppers, our countryside is full of edible delights in any season.
John Wright is the country's foremost expert in foraging and brings decades of experience, including as forager at the River Cottage, to this seasonal guide. Month by month, he shows us what species can be found and where, how to identify them, and how to store, use and cook them. You'll learn the stories behind the Latin names, the best way to tap a Birch tree, and how to fry an ant, make rosehip syrup and cook a hop omelette.
Fully illustrated throughout, with tips on kit, conservation advice and what to avoid, this is an indispensable guide for everyone interested in wild food, whether you want to explore the great outdoors, or are happiest foraging from your armchair.

About "The Forager’s Calendar":

  • Content: "The Forager’s Calendar" offers a comprehensive guide to foraging throughout the year. Each month features different wild foods that can be foraged in the UK, along with tips on identification, harvesting, and preparation.
  • Seasonal Focus: The book emphasizes the importance of seasonality in foraging, helping readers understand the natural cycles of wild plants and fungi. This seasonal approach ensures that foragers can find the best wild foods at the right time of year.
  • Practical Advice: Wright provides practical advice on sustainable foraging practices, ensuring that readers can enjoy nature's bounty without harming the environment. He also includes safety tips for avoiding toxic plants and fungi.
  • Recipes and Uses: The book includes a variety of recipes and suggestions for using foraged ingredients in cooking, making it a valuable resource for anyone looking to incorporate wild foods into their diet.
